channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Coronavirus: Thousands return to UK to beat France quarantine
item.description: Holidaymakers had just hours to return to the UK to avoid the 14-day self-isolation requirement.

item.title: VJ Day: UK commemorates 75th anniversary as royals lead tributes
item.description: Senior royals are to lead tributes to mark the day World War Two ended with the surrender of Japan.

item.title: A-levels and GCSEs: Free exam appeals for schools in England
item.description: England schools can appeal against A-level and GCSE grades for free, the education secretary says.

item.title: O'Sullivan beats Selby in thriller to reach final
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan recovers from the verge of defeat to beat Mark Selby 17-16 and set up a World Championship final against Kyren Wilson.

item.title: Bayern Munich 8-2 Barcelona: Brilliant Bayern smash Barca to reach Champions League semis
item.description: Bayern Munich send an ominous message to their Champions League rivals as they demolish Barcelona in a gloriously chaotic quarter-final tie in Lisbon.

item.title: Princess Anne gets military promotion as she celebrates 70th birthday
item.description: Three new photographs are also released to mark the 70th birthday of the Queen's only daughter.

item.title: US 2020: Postal service warns of delays in mail-in vote count
item.description: The agency warns that millions of mail-in votes may not arrive on time to be counted by election day.

item.title: Coronavirus: Businesses reopen as England lockdown eases further
item.description: Casinos, bowling alleys and soft play centres can now open their doors following a two-week delay.

item.title: Parents urged to stay up-to-date with children's vaccinations
item.description: Vaccinations are continuing as normal while jabs given in school are being rescheduled.

item.title: Belarus election: Exiled leader calls weekend of 'peaceful rallies'
item.description: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya tells people not to "stay on the sidelines", six days after a disputed vote.

item.title: Coronavirus cases stable across most of England
item.description: A survey by the Office for National Statistics suggests fewer than 0.05% of the population has the virus.

item.title: Robot boat completes three-week Atlantic mission
item.description: A UK uncrewed ocean-going vessel provides a glimpse of the future of robotic maritime operations.

item.title: Dolly Parton: 'Of course black lives matter!'
item.description: The legendary country singer has been reticent to share her political beliefs in the past.

item.title: The Papers: Free school exam appeals, and France 'exodus'
item.description: Several of Saturday's papers lead with travellers scrambling to return to the UK to avoid new quarantine measures.

item.title: Week in pictures: 8-14 August 2020
item.description: A selection of remarkable images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why Egypt has faced criticism over antibody tests
item.description: Egypt has faced criticism for testing frontline healthcare workers for coronavirus using antibody tests.

item.title: TikTok: New-found fame for ‘No Fizzy Drink Guy’
item.description: An Australian man documenting his addiction to soft drinks goes viral.

item.title: Gymshark: Ex-pizza delivery boy’s sportswear firm worth over £1bn
item.description: Ben Francis, the founder of sportswear company Gymshark, is now worth an estimated £700m.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'We're packing frantically' after France quarantine rule change
item.description: Holidaymakers weigh up whether to cut their trip short or face quarantine on return to the UK.

item.title: World War Two code-breaking sisters on Official Secrets Act and wartime memories
item.description: Pat and Jean Owtram signed the Official Secrets Act, agreeing not to talk about their roles - and so kept it from each other for 30 years.

item.title: Quiz of the week: Who was named the world's highest-paid male actor?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Coronavirus: 'The care home lockdown sent my senile grandad into spiral of decline'
item.description: Many people with dementia in care homes have been starved of the close family contact they depend on.

item.title: 'If you croak we don't care': Brutality in Belarus
item.description: The BBC hears shocking accounts of police brutality as the Belarus president defies mass protests.

item.title: Coronavirus: Test, trace and the curse of the 0300 phone number
item.description: England's test and trace system changed tack this week, as national teams struggle to find cases.

item.title: My Money: 'My mum's advice saved me from lockdown anxiety'
item.description: Lexy Oliver from Cheshire takes us through her week during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Putin memes flood social media
item.description: False and misleading claims are made online after Russia announced the rollout of a vaccine.

item.title: 'One cubicle toilet for about 26 of us' - sportswomen speak out
item.description: Almost two-thirds of elite British female athletes have experienced sexism in sport but the vast majority did not feel able to report it. Here, four women share their stories anonymously.

item.title: Results day: How do you celebrate one so strange?
item.description: Whether it was happy or sad, Thursday was the end of an era for many students and worthy of celebration.

item.title: BBC Women's Sport Survey: How decisions on abortion and starting a family affect female athletes
item.description: A BBC survey suggests 4% of elite British sportswomen have had abortions because of their sporting careers - here are some of their stories.

item.title: 'We have hit rock bottom' - Pique demands changes at 'humiliated' Barca
item.description: Gerard Pique says that big changes are needed at Barcelona following their "humiliating" 8-2 loss to Bayern Munich in the Champions League quarter-finals.

item.title: Cheptegei breaks 5,000m world record - report & highlights
item.description: Uganda's Joshua Cheptegei produces an astonishing run in Monaco to break the 16-year-old 5,000m world record by almost two seconds.

item.title: Rizwan and weather frustrate England in second Test - highlights & report
item.description: England are frustrated by gritty Pakistan batting and more bad weather on day two of the second Test at the Ageas Bowl.

item.title: 'It's football, it's people, it's Match of the Day': Celebrating 50 years of MOTD theme
item.description: BBC Sport looks back to 15 August 1970, to celebrate 50 years since the iconic Match of the Day theme tune was played on television for the very first time.

item.title: VJ Day: Ex-Scotland manager Bobby Brown remembers football during World War Two
item.description: Manchester City academy players Will and Charlie meet Bobby Brown, a former goalkeeper and Scotland manager who recalls how his life and career were changed by World War Two.

item.title: Sir Chris Hoy's Secret World of Japanese Bicycle Racing quiz
item.description: Sir Chris Hoy quizzes British cyclist Joe Truman on his Japanese language skills as the Olympic track hopeful spends time at a keirin school 200km from Tokyo.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does Covid-19 test-and-trace work?
item.description: People who have been in close contact with someone found to have Covid-19 are now being traced.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK's travel rules and which countries can you visit?
item.description: New rules mean people entering the UK from certain countries will not have to quarantine.

item.title: Coronavirus: How do I quarantine after returning from holiday abroad?
item.description: If you have to observe a 14-day isolation period after travelling from certain countries, here's what you need to know.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules on weddings?
item.description: Many weddings were cancelled during lockdown, while some will have to change to meet the new rules.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can I get facial treatment at a beauty salon?
item.description: More lockdown rules are being eased in England - how are customers being kept safe?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: France and the Netherlands are the latest places from where people must quarantine on arriving in the UK.

item.title: VJ Day: The forgotten African soldiers of the Burma Campaign
item.description: Ghanaian veteran Joseph Hammond, 95, reflects on the horrors of the Burma Campaign.

item.title: VJ Day: Burma veteran recalls being left in jungle
item.description: John Hutchin, 95, fought with a special operations force, the Chindits, during the Burma campaign.

item.title: VJ Day: A WW2 hero and a reckoning with Japan's past
item.description: Hiroo Onoda had sworn never to surrender. He believed the rest of his countrymen would do the same.

item.title: VJ Day: People celebrate with street parties and kisses
item.description: Victory over Japan Day marked the end of fighting in the Asia-Pacific region, and the end of WW2.
